Well worth reading this left-center & right-center report collaboration from @AEI @BrookingsInst \n\nhttps://t.co/cSFUo8rvie https://t.co/AugFBj1tE0

Research also shows that in many Black communities, people actually have a high regard for the law, and even want to have good relationships with the police. The issue is that they can’t trust the police. 7/\nhttps://t.co/jcxYfn8Xs6

This is a crisis of legitimacy. Legitimacy is the people’s belief in the institutions of government and their power to set rules and gain compliance. It is a core element in democracy.\n\nhttps://t.co/0IAKhmM641

When legitimacy goes down (such as after incidents of police violence), research clearly shows that whole communities withdraw from the police, per @just_shelter et. al. 6/ https://t.co/bkQKuK9TEq https://t.co/OvCkJEwbPr

For all of American history, the government has done exactly that to Black Americans. \nAnd “where the government has not done violence to Black people, it has failed to protect them.” @RadleyBalko explains the impact in this excellent article. 3/ https://t.co/RM0akJ1x9S

'The American government is failing to protect certain Americans. Policing is an arm of the state. Police violence is state violence. 
Over and again Black people have been killed, beaten, and abused by their government through its agents: the police.'

https://t.co/ZgepmKedDq

NEW from @DavidKennedyNYC: America is in a transformative period with regard to police violence. An incorrect response means an ongoing failure of our democracy. There is a lot of room for failure—but also an encouraging path forward. \n\nTHREAD: 1/ https://t.co/ypm8IPjrjM
"If the rule of law means anything, it means that those sworn to enforce it should not be above it."\n\nhttps://t.co/pEobqmwxAJ

This is a crisis of legitimacy. 
Legitimacy is the people’s belief in the institutions of government and their power to set rules and gain compliance. It is a core element in democracy. 5/

We need to be clear about what’s happening: The American government is failing to protect—and even selectively targeting—certain Americans. Policing is an arm of the state. Police violence is state violence. “George Floyd was inexplicably killed by his own government. 2/
